content.question: All of the following are ways that the legislative branch can check the powers of the executive branch EXCEPT:

choices.label: Congress may remove the president through its impeachment and conviction powers.
Congress may override a presidential veto.
Congress may pass a law declaring a presidential action unconstitutional.
The Senate may refuse to approve a presidential appointment.
The Senate may refuse to approve a treaty negotiated by the president.

content.answer: Congress may pass a law declaring a presidential action unconstitutional.

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Explain political principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
